body:
Ummm... this seems very dodgy.

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15061774/template-class-member-specialization-without-declaration-in-header suggests that the C++ standard states that specializations of C++ templates must be declared before they are used. The classic usage of `CAFFE_KNOWN_TYPE` is inside a C++ file, so these specializations are never declared outside of the object files. So you are violating the standard when you expect this to work.

body_text:
Ummm... this seems very dodgy.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15061774/template-class-member-specialization-without-declaration-in-header suggests that the C++ standard states that specializations of C++ templates must be declared before they are used. The classic usage of CAFFE_KNOWN_TYPE is inside a C++ file, so these specializations are never declared outside of the object files. So you are violating the standard when you expect this to work.
